Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Reflow skipped packages" (#7269) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
With the introduction of `Db2Monitoring`, we will likely discover many packages that are missing from V3.
We will need to reflow these packages. We will need to write an OPS tool to assist with this because, at least on DEV there are 200.

- [ ] DEV
- [ ] INT
- [ ] PROD

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget SxS search takes very long to return results" (#7312) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
1. go to nuget.org and login
2. go to to the SxS page
3. search for a term "aspnet"

Expected:
1. search results are displayed in less than a second

Actual:
1. search results take up to 10 seconds to be displayed.


This seems to happen when the new search has not been used for an extended period of time.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "'error NU5000 - Nuspec file does not exist in package' should either identify the package or reinstall it" (#8291) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

dotnet.exe --version: 3.0.100-preview5-011568

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a .csproj

2. Add a PackageReference to something not bundled with the .net sdk (e.g. ````<PackageReference Include="NUnit" Version="3.12.0" />````)

3. `dotnet restore`

4. Delete the .nuspec file for the package from the packages cache (e.g. %userprofile%\.nuget\packages\nunit\3.12.0\nunit.3.12.0.nuspec

5. Delete the obj\ directory next to the .csproj

6. `dotnet restore`

This will produce the following error: `error NU5000: Nuspec file does not exist in package`

## Desired behavior
One of the following should happen:
1. The error should identify which package id/version/install dir is broken.
    a. Otherwise the error is nearly inactionable without clearing the entire packages cache
2. Silently reinstall the package like would occur if the entire install dir was deleted

## Comments
* This reflects cache corruption; it is not a mainline scenario
* This is a real scenario that one of our devs encountered (though we don't know exactly how the bad state happened)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PM UI changes - unify Update/Installed tab" (#8290) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently the update/installed tabs differ in 3 ways. 

1. On the installed tab, all top level dependency are displayed.  On the updates tab, only the ones that have newer versions on the selected source(s) are displayed. 
1. The updates tabs has checkboxes that are used to allow a multi package update. 
1. The updates label has a number that says how many packages have updates. 

My proposal is to merge these 2 tabs into since so much of the information is redundant. 

1. Add a new checkbox to filter packages with updates only. 
1. Keep the checkboxes on by default (or enable it when the updates only filter is checked). 
1. Keep the label on the newly consolidated tab. 

//cc @karann-msft @anangaur Thoughts?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Best practices for lock files " (#8289) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We need docs/blog on the best practices for working with lock files. 

Motivated by https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8287. 

Incorporating self contained publish with locked mode on CIs requires some unobvious gymnastics. 

This and other related tips should ideally be self contained within a blog post or the docs. 

Keeping this in the NuGet/Home repo, as I believe it has higher visibility for both engineering & PMs. 

//cc @karann-msft @anangaur @rrelyea @bergbria
@NuGet/nuget-client

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Plugins:  improve diagnosability of plugin launch failure" (#8271) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: If a plugin fails on launch --- say, because of an unhandled exception --- or if a plugin times out during handshake, the error message ("A task was canceled.") [here](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/7fee43eeb1b5dbe0de3cb93ad0cb80b3a321e4a9/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/Plugins/PluginFactory.cs#L242) is unhelpful.
